petitions.title: Online Petitions
petitions.definition: PETITION means the request, complaint, notification or proposal formulated in writing or by electronic mail, which a citizen or a legally constituted organization can address to central and local public authorities and institutions, decentralized public services of ministries and other central bodies, national companies and societies, commercial companies of county or local interest, as well as autonomous administrations, hereinafter referred to as public authorities and institutions.
petitions.legalReference: (art. 2 of Government Ordinance no. 27/2002 on the regulation of petition resolution activities with subsequent amendments)
petitions.formTitle: To submit a petition, please fill out the following form:
petitions.fileHint: You can attach supporting documents (PDF, DOC, JPG - max. 10MB)
petitions.submitSuccess: Petition submitted successfully! You will receive a registration number by email.
petitions.disclaimer: According to GO no. 27/2002 on the regulation of petition resolution activities, public authorities and institutions are required to respond to petitions within 30 days from the registration date.

consilieriPage.introduction: The Local Council of Salonta Municipality is the deliberative authority that manages issues of local interest, operating under GEO 57/2019 on the Administrative Code, with subsequent amendments and additions. It consists of 17 councilors who carry out their activity in specialized Committees.
responsibilities: Approves or endorses, as appropriate, studies, forecasts and socio-economic development programs, territorial organization and planning documentation, including participation in county, regional, zonal and cross-border cooperation programs.
Approves the local budget, loans, credit transfers and the use of budget reserves; approves the closure of the budget year; establishes local taxes and fees, as well as special fees.
Administers the public and private domain of the commune or city.
Decides on granting administration, concession or lease of public property of the commune or city, as well as local public services.

Establishes public institutions, commercial companies and local public services; monitors, controls and analyzes their activity; establishes organization and operation norms for local public institutions and services.

Decides on the establishment and reorganization of autonomous local companies; exercises all shareholder rights in commercial companies it has established; decides on the privatization of these companies.
Analyzes and approves territorial planning and urban planning documentation for localities; approves allocation of local budget funds for flood, fire, disaster and dangerous weather protection.
Establishes measures for the construction, maintenance and modernization of roads, bridges, and local communication infrastructure.
Approves, within its competence, technical-economic documentation for local investment works and ensures conditions for their implementation.
Contributes to organizing scientific, cultural, artistic, sports and leisure activities.

Acts for the protection and restoration of the environment to improve quality of life; contributes to the protection, conservation, restoration and enhancement of historical and architectural monuments, parks and nature reserves.
Ensures freedom of trade and encourages free initiative.

comisiiPage.description: The specialized committees of the Local Council analyze and approve draft decisions before they are submitted to a vote in the Local Council plenary.

sessionsPage.description: Salonta Local Council meetings are public and can be watched live via Zoom.

cityStats.title: Salonta in Numbers
cityStats.subtitle: Discover the essential facts about our city

istoricPage.intro: The Municipality of Salonta, the second most populous in Bihor County after Oradea, is located in the westernmost part of the country, near the border with Hungary. The natural conditions specific to the plain area have favored the existence of human settlements since ancient times.
istoricPage.firstAttestation: The first documentary attestation of Salonta dates from 1332 when, in a papal document, the settlement is called "Socerdas de Ville Zalantha". Subsequently, the name of the locality underwent several changes, until it reached the form "Szalonta" in 1587.
istoricPage.toldiPeriod: Until the 16th century, Salonta belonged to the Toldi noble family and had no great importance in the area, mainly due to its location near Culișer Fortress, a strong political-economic center that was raised to the rank of city in the 12th century. During this period, the village of Salonta comprised approximately 50 houses set among swamps and reeds, with about 250-300 inhabitants.
istoricPage.bocskaiCaption: The Prince of Transylvania, Stephanus Bocskai
istoricPage.turkishDestruction: The Turks destroyed both Culișer Fortress and old Salonta in 1598. The fortress was not repopulated, but after a short period of time, Salonta recovered. This was due to the return of part of the refugee population and the settlement here, by order of the Prince of Transylvania, Bocskai István, of three hundred free soldiers whose task was to defend the border regions against the Turks.
istoricPage.watchtower: During the same period, the watchtower in the center of the settlement was built, known today as the "Csonka Tower", which served as an observation post. The soldiers of Salonta received significant land areas and enjoyed privileges that were later increased through the granting of noble titles.
istoricPage.privileges: The privileges and freedoms granted to the inhabitants led to the numerical growth of the city's population and its transformation into a strong economic center, especially following the right to organize fairs.
istoricPage.tradeGrowth: Because the city is located at the edge of the Principality of Transylvania and near the territories dominated by the Turks, merchants from Transylvania met those from the Ottoman occupation zone at the Salonta Fair. The intense exchange of goods led to the rapid development of the settlement and the emergence of small industry: leather tanning, sandal making, boot making, fur making, weaving, and blacksmithing.
istoricPage.tradeFairs: The produced goods met local needs and were also sold at eastern and southern fairs in Tinca, Beiuș, Ineu, Chișineu Criș and at fairs in the Ottoman occupation zone, at Gyula and Orosháza.
istoricPage.rakoczi: In 1659, the Prince of Transylvania, Rákóczi György II, ordered the burning of the city, which began to be repopulated only at the end of the 17th century. As a result of successes against the Turks, Austria gained control of Hungary from 1686 and Transylvania from 1688.
istoricPage.leopoldPrivileges: Emperor Leopold strengthened the privileges of Salonta's inhabitants, but in 1700 the Imperial Court renounced the military services of the free soldiers and canceled their privileges. This led to disagreements between the inhabitants of Salonta and the Eszterházy noble family, a process that was resolved in the revolutionary year 1848.
istoricPage.revolution1848: During the Revolution of 1848, the poet Arany János distinguished himself through his activity. His verses reflect the poet's participation in the events.
istoricPage.guilds: After a brief period of freedom, the territory of Salonta was reintegrated into the Habsburg Empire under an absolutist regime. At the beginning of the 19th century, craftsmen organized themselves into guilds. The first guild, that of bootmakers, was established in 1820, and that of tanners in 1836. In 1872, craftsmen, with the exception of bootmakers, formed the Mixed Union of Craftsmen. At the end of the 19th century, nearly 500 masters with operating licenses were registered.
istoricPage.historicalImageCaption: Salonta at the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries
istoricPage.modernization: At the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries, the region developed intensively. During this period, swamp drainage works began, the railway line was built, and the first capitalist institutions in industry and commerce appeared. There was also a strong influx of rural population to the city.
istoricPage.borderCity: The movement of European peoples for self-determination following World War I led to the dissolution of the Habsburg Empire and the formation of nation states. Under the new conditions, Salonta became one of the border points between Romania and Hungary.
istoricPage.industrialGrowth: The city's industrial development intensified after 1948 through the establishment of new economic units. Salonta thus became a city with a continuously developing industrial-agrarian economy.
istoricPage.industries: The food industry, textile, clothing, leather, fur and footwear industries, as well as wood processing, are industrial branches with old traditions in the area and currently account for 65% of the city's global production, with the food industry being dominant. Alongside these, the machine-building industry has appeared and developed.
istoricPage.touristAttractions: Visitors to Salonta can stop at the houses that belonged to poets Arany János, Sinka István, and Zilahy Lajos, lay a flower at their statues or that of the 1848 revolutionary Kossuth Lajos, or admire the Csonka Tower or the "Arany" Palace which houses the "Teodor Neș" Municipal Library and an art gallery. The city's churches and the Town Hall building are also worth visiting.
istoricPage.opportunities: Leaving behind the city's tourist attractions, Salonta can be a starting point for hunting and fishing enthusiasts. At the same time, Salonta offers multiple opportunities for interested investors and businesspeople, being a city of all possibilities.

oraseInfratitePage.intro: The Municipality of Salonta maintains twinning and cooperation relationships with cities in Hungary and Slovakia, promoting cultural and economic exchanges.
oraseInfratitePage.aboutText: City twinning represents a form of cooperation that promotes cultural, economic, and social exchanges between communities. These partnerships facilitate joint projects, experience sharing, and strengthen ties between peoples.

culturaPage.intro: The city of Salonta has given universal culture numerous personalities:

personalities.foldiJanos: Földi János (1755-1801) enlightenment scholar, scientist, naturalist, linguist and physician
personalities.lovassyLaszlo: Lovassy László (1844-1898) writer, translator, ethnographer, folklorist
personalities.sinkaIstvan: Sinka István (1897-1969) poet and prose writer
personalities.teodorNes: Teodor Neș from Mădăras (1891-1975) pedagogue, publicist, eminent politician

culturaPage.museumIntro: The most representative was the activity of the poet Arany János. As a reward for his merits in the socio-cultural field, the museum bears his name. The "Arany János" Memorial Museum is housed in the oldest building in the city, the only medieval construction, declared a historical monument and visited by over 10,000 tourists annually.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio1: He was born in Salonta in 1817, being the tenth child of a poor family; of the ten siblings, only two survived. This tragedy led the parents to take special care of the education of their youngest child.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio2: He completed ten grades in Salonta, after which he continued his studies in Debrecen. Due to financial difficulties, he had to work from a young age. He could not complete his studies at the Debrecen college.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio3: For a while he was an actor in a theater company with which he traveled through the country. He settled in Salonta, living from a modest position as deputy notary. He got married and led a quiet life. The notary position helped him know social life, which is critically exposed in the work Az elveszett alkotmány (The Lost Constitution), for which he won an award from the Kisfaludy Society.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio4: His first masterpiece is the work Toldi. Through the publication of this poetic story, Arany became known, valued, and considered by all readers of his people as a great national poet. He also gained the friendship of Petőfi, who enthusiastically congratulated him through a poem.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio5: During the revolution of 1848, he was an enthusiastic tribune alongside Petőfi. In the 1850s, he arrived in Nagykőrös, where the poet wrote his first ballads.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio6: He left Nagykőrös and in 1860 settled in Budapest. He dedicated himself to literary activity, but wasted much time in administrative positions; he was also secretary of the Hungarian Academy.
culturaPage.aranyJanosBio7: He passed away in Budapest in 1882.
culturaPage.culturalEventsIntro: The Municipality of Salonta hosts numerous cultural events annually that celebrate the city's diversity and cultural heritage:
culturaPage.event1: Salonta City Days - annual festival with concerts, shows and cultural activities
culturaPage.event2: Arany János Festival - event dedicated to the poet Arany János
culturaPage.event3: Traditional celebrations - events celebrating Romanian and Hungarian traditions
culturaPage.event4: Art exhibitions - displays of local and national artists' works

economiePage.intro: Salonta's economy is based on a balanced mix of agriculture, industry, commerce and services, leveraging its strategic geographic position at the border with Hungary.

agriculture.title: Agriculture
agriculture.description: The agricultural sector is an important component of the local economy, with cereal and vegetable production and animal husbandry.

industry.title: Industry
industry.description: Manufacturing industry, especially in food and construction, contributes to economic development.

commerce.title: Commerce and Services
commerce.description: The commercial and services sector has developed significantly, offering diverse opportunities for business and employment.

tourism.title: Tourism
tourism.description: Cultural tourism, based on Arany János heritage and local traditions, attracts visitors from Romania and Hungary.

economiePage.borderCrossingText: Due to the city's favorable geographic location, in 1996 the Border Crossing Point to Hungary 'Salonta – Méhkerék' was opened, 14 km from the city, accessible via a modernized asphalt road.
economiePage.industrialZoneUtilities: The industrial zone is equipped with the following utilities: natural gas, national road access, sewerage, drinking and industrial water, electricity, telephone network.
economiePage.industrialActivityText: Industrial activity is predominantly concentrated in the northwestern part of the city, as shown in the General Urban Plan, specifically in Territorial Reference Unit No. 1, located within the municipality's built-up area. Near this zone is the Salonta CFR Halt, enabling passenger and freight transport by rail.
economiePage.mainFunctionsText: The main functions of Salonta city are characterized by the following activities: industrial, agricultural, service, socio-cultural and commercial, passenger and freight transport, administrative-coordination.
economiePage.industrialDevelopmentText: The development of industrial production in this city was contributed to by the development of crafts, the presence of workforce, and the favorable geographic position. The municipality of Salonta has a highly qualified workforce in all fields.
economiePage.mainIndustriesText: Among the main industrial branches we mention: food industry, machine building, textiles, clothing, leather, fur, footwear, and wood processing.

potential.borderCrossing: Border crossing point - main driver of socio-economic development in all sectors
potential.freeZone: Possibility of establishing a free zone
potential.crossBorderCooperation: Cooperation zone for development between border regions
potential.developmentCorridor: Area located on the main county development corridor
potential.majorRoutes: Major county, national and international road and rail routes

economiePage.investmentText1: For potential investors, approximately 20 hectares would be available within the city limits. To provide developed land to potential investors, Salonta Local Council is studying the possibility of developing an industrial area, in accordance with current legislation, on 10 hectares of private city property, free of encumbrances, intended for industrial activity.
economiePage.investmentText2: In addition to the advantages of locations intended for potential investors, the Local Council, in accordance with current legislation, may grant various tax incentives based on certain criteria.
economiePage.investmentText3: An important element for investors is the proximity to the border.
economiePage.hotelSlaviaDesc: 4-star hotel with restaurant, located in the historic center, featuring Romanian and Slovak specialties.
economiePage.motelMilleniumDesc: Affordable accommodation with modern facilities and free parking.
economiePage.hotelAncoraDesc: Guesthouse with restaurant, offering accommodation and traditional Romanian dishes.
economiePage.turistsalDesc: Travel agency with over 12 years of experience, offering tour packages to Hungary, Croatia and international circuits.
economiePage.investorCTAText: The Local Council, together with Salonta City Hall, is at the disposal of those interested in investing in Salonta.

generalePage.contPlatiDesc: Account for payment via postal order, bank transfer, bank cards and other payment systems, according to current legal provisions, for document copying services requested under Law no. 544/2001:
generalePage.contPlatiDetails: Opened at Salonta Treasury, beneficiary: Municipality of Salonta, code 4593423
generalePage.ghidulCetateanului: Citizen's Guide - Transparency in Public Administration
generalePage.ceLegea52Desc: The transparency law ensures the openness of public administration activity towards citizens through two important mechanisms:
generalePage.ceLegea52Item1: Your participation in the process of drafting normative regulations
generalePage.ceLegea52Item2: Your participation in the decision-making process
generalePage.cuiSeAdreseazaDesc: The transparency law involves collaboration between two partners: public administration and the recipients of regulations developed by it (citizens, non-governmental organizations, business associations).
generalePage.cePresupuneDesc1: We are obliged to make public draft normative regulations before they are adopted.
generalePage.cePresupuneDesc2: After this moment, if you are interested, you have the opportunity to formulate suggestions and recommendations regarding the regulations presented in draft form.
generalePage.avantajeTitle: What are the advantages of applying this law for you?
generalePage.avantajeItem1: You are informed about proposed normative draft regulations to be adopted
generalePage.avantajeItem2: It encourages you to express your views on these projects and thus get involved in solving community problems
generalePage.proceduraDesc1: We publish an announcement informing you that a certain draft decision with public character has been initiated and requesting you to express your opinions, proposals, suggestions in writing, the deadline for submission, as well as the place where related materials can be studied.
generalePage.proceduraDesc2: Legally constituted associations may request the organization of public debates on the draft decision, and we will communicate the date, time and place where the debate will take place (within maximum 10 days of the request).
generalePage.proceduraDesc3: Proposals and suggestions will be analyzed by the initiator and local council, they have a recommendation character, the decision to include them in the final decision belongs to the public authority.
generalePage.contestareDesc: The methods of contesting the decision of the authority or public institution in the situation where the person considers himself/herself harmed regarding the right of access to requested public interest information are provided in art. 21 and 22 of Law no. 544/2001:
generalePage.contestareItem1: Administrative complaint – to be submitted to the head of the authority or public institution
generalePage.contestareItem2: Complaint to the administrative litigation section of the court in whose territorial jurisdiction the person resides or in whose territorial jurisdiction the headquarters of the authority or public institution is located
generalePage.contestareNote: The methods of contesting the authority's decision in the situation where the person considers himself/herself harmed by an administrative act are provided by Law 554/2004 on administrative litigation.
generalePage.infoNote: Documents on this page will be loaded from the database. Links marked with '#' are placeholders and will be updated later with actual documents.

dezbateriPage.introText: According to Law no. 52/2003 on decision-making transparency in public administration, citizens can participate in public debates organized by Salonta City Hall. Here you can find the minutes and documents related to public debates.

coronavirusPage.moreInfo: For updated information regarding Salonta City Hall services, please visit the Contact page or call the displayed phone numbers.

declaratiiConsiliuPage.infoText: Declarations are published in accordance with legal provisions and are also available on the National Integrity Agency (ANI) website. To access a document, click the corresponding button next to the councilor's name.

rapoarteAuditPage.description: Audit reports conducted by the Romanian Court of Accounts for Salonta City Hall.
rapoarteAuditPage.infoText: Audit reports are published in accordance with current legislation and are available for download in PDF format.

studiiPage.description: Feasibility studies and other studies conducted for Salonta Municipality projects.
studiiPage.noStudies: No studies published at this time.

strategiePage.description: Strategic documents guiding the medium and long-term development of Salonta Municipality.

pmudPage.description: The Sustainable Urban Mobility Plan (SUMP) establishes the vision and objectives for transport and mobility in Salonta Municipality.
pmudPage.infoText: SUMP is the strategic document that ensures an integrated approach to urban mobility, with objectives to improve accessibility, safety and quality of life in the municipality.

pnrrPage.description: Projects funded through the National Recovery and Resilience Plan (NRRP) implemented in Salonta Municipality.
pnrrPage.c10Title: C10 - Local Green Transport and ICT Development
pnrrPage.infoText: NRRP projects are funded by the European Union through NextGenerationEU. For additional information on implementation status, contact Salonta City Hall.

proiecteEuropenePage.description: European-funded projects implemented or in progress in Salonta Municipality.
proiecteEuropenePage.fundingNotice: The presented projects are co-financed from European funds through various operational programs. For more information about each project, consult the related documents or contact Salonta City Hall.

snaPage.title: SNA Sectoral Plan
snaPage.description: Sectoral action plan for implementing the National Anti-Corruption Strategy at Salonta City Hall.
snaPage.infoText: The National Anti-Corruption Strategy is the public policy document that establishes objectives, principles and directions of action for preventing and combating corruption in public administration.

voluntariatPage.title: Volunteering Activity
voluntariatPage.description: Information and forms for volunteering activities at Salonta City Hall.
voluntariatPage.introText: Volunteering is an excellent way to contribute to the community's wellbeing and gain valuable experience. Salonta City Hall offers volunteering opportunities in various fields.
voluntariatPage.contactInfo: For more information about volunteering programs or to register, contact Salonta City Hall at the phone numbers displayed on the website.

svsuPage.title: Voluntary Emergency Service
svsuPage.description: Information about SVSU Salonta, intervention plans and educational materials for emergency prevention.
svsuPage.missionText: The Voluntary Emergency Service (SVSU) has the role of ensuring the prevention and management of emergency situations at the municipal level, protecting the lives and property of citizens.
svsuPage.emergencyText: The single emergency number 112 is free and operates 24/7.

programRegionalNordVestPage.description: Projects funded through the North-West Regional Program 2021-2027 from the European Regional Development Fund of the European Union.
programRegionalNordVestPage.moreInfo: For detailed information about other programs co-funded by the European Union, please visit
programRegionalNordVestPage.investInFuture: We invest in the future of the region!
programRegionalNordVestPage.fundedBy: ADR North-West funds this project through the North-West Regional Program 2021-2027 from the European Regional Development Fund of the European Union.

proiecteLocalePage.description: Projects funded from the local budget in the fields of culture, environment and sports. Access the necessary documents for submitting projects and evaluation results.
proiecteLocalePage.infoNotice: Local projects are funded from the budget of Salonta Municipality and aim to support cultural, environmental protection and sports activities in the local community.

adapostCainiPage.description: Information about the stray dog shelter in Salonta Municipality and related management program documents.

acteNecesarePage.description: Consult the list of required documents for various procedures at Salonta City Hall.

autorizatiiConstruirePage.infoText: List of building permits issued by Salonta City Hall. Documents are published in accordance with current legal provisions.
autorizatiiConstruirePage.noteText: Documents on this page are published in accordance with current legal provisions.

bugetPage.infoText: The local budget of Salonta Municipality, quarterly financial statements and budget execution accounts. Documents are published in accordance with current legal provisions.
bugetPage.noteText: Documents on this page are published in accordance with current legal provisions.

certificateUrbanismPage.infoText: List of urbanism certificates issued by Salonta City Hall. The urbanism certificate is an informative document through which the public authority provides the applicant with information about the legal, economic and technical regime of land and existing constructions.
certificateUrbanismPage.noteText: For additional information about urbanism certificates, please contact the Urbanism Department of City Hall.
certificateUrbanismPage.noDocuments: No urbanism certificates found in the database.

concursuriPage.infoText: Competitions for vacant positions at Salonta City Hall and mayor's dispositions regarding their organization.
concursuriPage.noteText: For additional information about competitions, please contact the Human Resources Department of City Hall.
concursuriPage.noJobs: No job announcements found in the database.

dispozitiiPage.infoText: The mayor's dispositions are administrative acts with normative or individual character, issued by the mayor in the exercise of his legal powers.
dispozitiiPage.noDocuments: No dispositions found in the database.
dispozitiiPage.noteText: The dispositions published on this page are those of public interest. For additional information, please contact Salonta City Hall.

gdprPage.infoText: Salonta City Hall processes personal data in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR) and current national legislation.
gdprPage.noteText: Requests for exercising the rights provided by GDPR can be submitted at the City Hall headquarters or by email to: primaria@salonta.ro. You will receive a response within 30 days of receiving the request.

taxeImpozitePage.infoText: Local taxes and fees levels are established annually by Local Council decision, in accordance with the Fiscal Code provisions.
taxeImpozitePage.noteText: For payment of local taxes and fees, please use the IBAN codes available in the documents above or visit the City Hall counter.

licitatiiPage.infoText: Public auctions take place at the Salonta City Hall headquarters. For registration, please consult the documents attached to each auction.
licitatiiPage.noteText: To participate in auctions, you must submit the required documents at the City Hall registry by the deadline specified in each announcement.

mediuPage.infoText: Salonta City Hall provides citizens with information on environmental protection, waste management, water quality, and green spaces.
mediuPage.salubrizareDesc: Documents on waste management and sanitation services
mediuPage.noteText: For additional information regarding environmental protection or to report issues, please contact the specialized department of the City Hall.

oferteTerenPage.infoText: The sale of agricultural land located in extravilan areas is carried out in compliance with the preemption right of co-owners, tenants, neighbors, and the Romanian state, according to Law no. 17/2014.
oferteTerenPage.noteText: Agricultural land sale offers are displayed at the City Hall headquarters for 45 working days. For additional information, contact the Agricultural Office.

planuriUrbanisticePage.infoText: The General Urban Plan (PUG) establishes regulations regarding land use, traffic network organization, and the development of public utilities in the locality.
planuriUrbanisticePage.noteText: To consult zonal urban plans (PUZ) or detail urban plans (PUD) pending approval, please contact the Urbanism Department.

publicatiiCasatoriePage.infoText: In accordance with legal provisions, marriage publications are displayed for 10 days at the city hall headquarters and on the institution's website.
publicatiiCasatoriePage.noteText: For marriage oppositions or additional information, please contact the Civil Status Service of the City Hall.

publicatiiVanzarePage.infoText: Sale publications are displayed in accordance with the provisions of the Civil Procedure Code and requests from bailiff offices.
publicatiiVanzarePage.noteText: For additional information regarding sale publications, please contact the City Hall or the competent bailiff office.

receptieLucrariPage.infoText: Documentation required for the reception at the completion of construction works.
receptieLucrariPage.initialDocsDesc: To be submitted at the city hall registry
receptieLucrariPage.doc1Desc: Form room 11, Ground Floor – to be submitted at the city hall registry at least 15 days before the date set by the authorization beneficiary for the reception
receptieLucrariPage.doc2: Proof of payment of fees to the State Construction Inspectorate – Bihor
receptieLucrariPage.onSiteDocsDesc: On the date set for reception, through the beneficiary's care, the following documents shall be handed over to the city hall representative (they are NOT submitted together with the convocation, but presented on site)
receptieLucrariPage.siteDoc1: Designers' reports (architect, structural engineer, installations, etc.)
receptieLucrariPage.siteDoc5: Updated site plan / Location plan, prepared by ANCPI authorized surveyor
receptieLucrariPage.siteDoc6: Standard form "RECEPTION REPORT at completion of works" (room 11, Ground Floor) - 2 original copies
receptieLucrariPage.noteText: For additional details or to obtain the necessary forms, please contact room 11, Ground Floor, at Salonta City Hall.

regulamentePublicePage.infoText: Regulations adopted by the Local Council of Salonta Municipality and approved by its decisions.
regulamentePublicePage.noteText: For additional information about current regulations or clarifications, please contact the relevant department at the City Hall.

reteleTelecomPage.infoText: According to Law no. 159/2016 on the regime of electronic communications network infrastructure, documents regarding access to public or private property for the construction of telecommunications networks.
reteleTelecomPage.noteText: For requests regarding access to public or private property for the construction of telecommunications networks, please contact Salonta City Hall.

seipPage.title: Public Community Service for Computerized Person Records
seipPage.description: Established by Local Council Decision no. 6/2005 under the authority of the Local Council and is under the coordination of the municipality secretary.
seipPage.formsLocation: Forms and the list of documents required for issuing documents in this matter can be found at the City Hall headquarters, room 5, ground floor.
seipPage.locationDetails: Salonta City Hall, Room 5, Ground Floor
seipPage.foundedDetails: LCL no. 6/2005, under the authority of the Local Council

solicitareInformatiiPage.infoText: According to Law no. 544/2001 on free access to public interest information, any person has the right to request and obtain public interest information from authorities and public institutions.
solicitareInformatiiPage.formDescription: Form for requesting public interest information

somatiiPage.infoText: According to legal provisions, summons and collective announcements for public communication of fiscal administrative acts are posted on the website of Salonta City Hall.
somatiiPage.footerText: For additional information or to settle obligations, please visit the Local Taxes and Fees Service at Salonta City Hall.

sedintePage.title: Local Council Sessions
sedintePage.description: Calendar of Local Council sessions of Salonta Municipality, including agendas, minutes, and video recordings.

carieraPage.title: Career and Competitions
carieraPage.description: Job vacancies and hiring competitions at Salonta City Hall.
carieraPage.noOpenPositions: There are no job vacancies at this time.

raportStudiuPage.title: Reports and Studies
raportStudiuPage.description: Audit reports, studies and analyses prepared for Salonta Municipality.
raportStudiuPage.author: Author
